info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 6 at 5:43PM PDT until June 6 at 6:00PM PDT by NWS Hanford CA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...Portions of central and northern California, including the following counties, in central California, Madera and Mariposa. In northern California, Tuolumne.
* WHEN...Until 600 PM PDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 543 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Merced Lake Ranger Station, Merced Lake High Sierra Camp, Vogelsang High Sierra Camp, Morraine Dome Campground, Little Yosemite Valley Ranger Station and Little Yosemite Valley Campground. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
